results.title: Jawpan
results.brief_description: Otaku and his robot friend Knowbot stumble across an evil force when out for a good time at th e”Nice Life” ATM. When the world is threatened with destruction by a “type 1 error”, Otaku and Knowbot must save the day by re-initialising planet earth.

results.title: Icaros
results.creator_credit: Amos Winikoff, John Bird and David Atkinson
results.brief_description: An adaptation to film of an exercise in dance and music. The animation reveals new aspects of what was an event of true improvisation. A hand drawn dance sequence which revolves around elements of the sun, light, and joy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Amos Winikoff, John Bird and David Atkinson

results.title: Harry Bachelor
results.brief_description: Harry Bachelor loves his city, loves his life…until, a lone parking meter with canabalistic tendencies inhabits his street. While Harry tries to cope, the trying meter swells in greed and size to become a larger than life sparring partner. Will Harry fight this all the way to City Hall? or will Harry snap under the strain adopting uncharacteristic behaviour?
results.description: Harry Bachelor loves his city, loves his life…until, a lone parking meter with canabalistic tendencies inhabits his street. results.title: Blue
results.brief_description: Travellers crossing a post-apolcalyptic landscape unearth a time capsule containing the accumulated wealth and knowledge of a now extinct society (ours). They are now faced with a cruel dilemma: should they study this ancient civilization or simply consume its last remaining treasures?

results.title: Alex and the beast within
results.creator_credit: David Atkinson, John Bird and Dominic O'Brien
results.brief_description: Cities are a hard place, some say they’re filled with sharks. One man haunted by this belief disappears into his fantasy emerging with the realisation that perhaps there are dragons too.

results.title: Silent Number
results.creator_credit: Hugh Burton, Jamie Blanks and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Babysitter Nicole is subjected to a horrific night of phone calls from a guy called Matt, claiming to be beaten by his father and imprisoned in a cold place. When a bloodied man comes to the door claiming that he and his wife have been in an accident, she decides it is time to call the police. Cast includes Bronwyn Jones and John Brumpton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh Burton, Jamie Blanks and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television

results.title: The Fair go: winning the 1967 referendum
results.creator_credit: Canute Films, Open Learning Agency of Australia and Pat Laughren
results.brief_description: This documentary commemorates the 10 year campaign that won an unprecedented 90.77% Yes vote in the 1967 Referendum about Indigenous citizenship. Until that referendum the people of the oldest civilisation in the world were not counted as citizens in their own land. Told through personal interviews and rare archival footage, this film details the efforts of the people who helped change the Constitution. Narrated by Deborah Mailman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Canute Films, Open Learning Agency of Australia and Pat Laughren

results.title: Three Mile Creek (MAC)
results.creator_credit: Alyssa Rothwell and Department of Visual Communication, RMIT
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “RMIT Collection”.
This CD ROM is a collection of anecdotal accounts inspired by the experience of growing up in rural Australia. Music, dialogue and soundscape evoke the richness of the environment and create a sense of being there. A contemplative approach is the key to enjoying the stories. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Recommended for use on a Power MacIntosh with a minimum of 15MB free RAM.
